messages.message:
A few Friday afternoon thoughts of some small rainy day features that might be useful:


• Cron-style Flow scheduling
• Ability to attach a "parameters" file to Apply UDF. Its contents get passed in the kwargs.
• Code helpers to quickly create Apply UDF of the following form: `extend_row(ibocr_row) -> ibocr_row` . We seem to co-mingle extraction code with transformation code a lot in UDFs. It might be useful to more explicitly separate those steps so we can independently develop and evaluate. (E.g.: Extraction step is to find the messy sentence with the information in it. Transformation step is to interpret that information.... we can have separate development/testing processes for these)
yeah `cron` goes back to the 70s I think :slightly_smiling_face:

```Developer(s)	AT&T Bell Laboratories
Initial release	May 1975; 44 years ago```

for “parameters” to a Apply UDF — I believe you can use “runtime_config” for this. It’s a Dict[Text, Text] which you can pass at runtime, and then Apply UDF gets CONFIG as a variable which you can reference.

Were you wanting a different feature?

Will likely have to talk in person about extend_row and how we can separate extraction code from transformation code — would like to understand your thoughts better there
BAML team was asking about scheduling flow. +1   for it
SC had asked for scheduler as well and the infra team committed to early Q1 timeline for this
